subject: Implementation of CCEA decisions dated 28.11.2019 in respect of filing of objections/ petitions U/s 34 of the Arbitations & Conciliation (Amendment) Act; 2015 (A&C act) and any appeals thereto
text: HRdq <cty TTTFNf nfearrut 344 / Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (&34 @dr- &k_{thTf #AT4) Ta7 Fax : 91-11-25093507 25093514 9l National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) m-5 & 6, #ar-10, ERGT, # fort-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 NHAVPolicy Guidelines/Modification in SOP/2020 No. 2.1.35/2020 dated 06 March 2020 [Decision taken on the File No. NHAI/Legal &Arbn: Cell/ Misc. /2020] Sub: Implementation of CCEA decisions dated 28.11.2019 in respect of filing of objections/ petitions Uls 34 of the Arbitration & Conciliation (Amendment) Act, 2015 (A&C Act) and any appeal(s) thereto. The following direction on the subject was given vide MoRTH letter no NH- 35014/39/2019-H dated 14.02.2020 (copy enclosed) & OM No.N-14070/14/2016- PPPAU dated 28.11.2019 of NITI Aayog (copy enclosed): Para-3(i) of OM dated 28.11.2019 of NITI Aayog "With respect to arbitral awards decided in favour of the contractors/ concessionaires, the concerned Government Entity will take the decision to initiate proceedings for setting aside of the arbitral award, and any appeal (s) thereto, with the opinion of a Law Officer -Attorney- General for India the Solicitor General for India the Additional Solicitor- General for India in consultation with the Department of Legal Affairs ("DOLAS ) at the Ministry of Law & Justice as per the procedure laid down in this respect: DOLA is to ensure that the aforementioned process of soliciting and communicating the opinion of Law Officer to the concerned Government Entity is completed within 30 (thirty) of the receipt of request. 2. To implement the aforesaid direction, Para-7 of SoP  (Policy Guidelines- 2.1.22/2017) dated 01.06.2017 is modified as under: 3_ Immediately after receipt of Arbitral Award, following actions shall be taken: - The Presenting Officer of NHAI is personally responsible for sending scanned copy by e-mail/Portal of the arbitral award to Member (Admn:); CGM(Legal); & CGM(T) at HQ within one working of receipt of the arbitral award: Technical Divisions after receipt of Arbitral Award shall take action to file correction/ interpretation or seek additional award in terms of Section-33 cf the Arbitration & Conciliation Act, if required within 7 Days from the date of award published by Ld, AT.
